author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court extended a pause on $4 billion in food aid, likely ensuring that millions of low-income families won’t get assistance until Congress reopens the government and provides full benefits.
title: Supreme Court Extends Pause on SNAP Food Aid as Families Wait

author: Jen Judson
description: A US aircraft carrier strike group arrived in Latin America, the Pentagon said, adding to a military buildup in the region that the Trump administration says is aimed at narco-traffickers but has also prompted questions about possible attacks on Venezuela.
title: US Aircraft Carrier Joins Military Buildup in Latin America

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: Aides to President Donald Trump have spent the days following Zohran Mamdani’s victory in the New York City mayoral race reviewing federal funds that benefit the city to potentially suspend or cancel, a White House official said Tuesday, highlighting the threat of retribution over the democratic socialist’s win.
title: Trump Aides Review Funds for New York City After Mamdani Win

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: California Governor Gavin Newsom swept into the COP30 climate summit in Brazil with all the fanfare of a head of state.
title: Newsom Rebukes Absent Trump at Global Climate Talks in Brazil

author: J.J. McCorvey
description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau told a federal court Monday that the Trump administration has used a new legal opinion that prevents it from drawing money from the Federal Reserve, setting it on a course to deplete its funding by the end of the year.
title: CFPB Says Money Poised to Run Out After Opinion on Fed Funding

author: Galit Altstein
description: Ron Dermer, Israel’s minster of strategic affairs and close ally of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, announced he is stepping down, weeks after helping secure the release of most Israeli hostages as part of a ceasefire with Hamas.
title: Netanyahu Adviser Ron Dermer Steps Down With Hostages Released

author: Gerry Smith, Robert Langreth, Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: The US Food and Drug Administration has named Richard Pazdur as its lead drug regulator, turning to a longtime official to stabilize the agency after a period of turmoil.
title: FDA Names Pazdur Top Drug Regulator After Tidmarsh Resigns

author: Caitlin Reilly, Derek Wallbank
description: Some 24 million Americans may see health-care premiums spike in January.
title: Deal to End the Shutdown Leaves Obamacare Cliff Unresolved

author: Katy O'Donnell
description: Days after Donald Trump’s party lost several key election contests that centered on cost-of-living concerns, the president floated the prospect of a 50-year mortgage to help voters tackle one of their top concerns: housing affordability.
title: Trump’s 50-Year Mortgage Loses Steam as Industry Questions Costs

author: Alex Wickham
description: Allies of UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer have launched an effort to ward off a leadership challenge from one of his best-known cabinet ministers, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Starmer Allies Launch Effort to Ward Off a Leadership Challenge

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: California Governor Gavin Newsom declared a planned Trump administration proposal to sell new oil drilling rights off the US West Coast “dead on arrival.”
title: Newsom Calls Trump Offshore Oil Drilling Plan ‘Dead on Arrival’

author: Sophie Alexander, Fola Akinnibi
description: The US military is exploring whether to build a temporary base capable of housing 10,000 people near Gaza, according to an internal contracting document, as the US pushes for a stabilization force to monitor a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas.
title: US Military Explores Building Base for 10,000 People ‘Near Gaza’

author: Alex Morales, Will Standring
description: The UK government defended the British Broadcasting Corp. against accusations of institutional bias, as it sought to lower the temperature of the crisis that’s escalated at the national broadcaster in recent days over a misleading edit of remarks by Donald Trump.
title: UK’s Nandy Defends BBC Against Accusations of Institutional Bias

author: Molly Smith, Skylar Woodhouse
description: White House National Economic Director Kevin Hassett said the record-long government shutdown means that some of the economic data that was supposed to be collected in October may never be recorded, making it difficult to get a comprehensive look at the health of the US economy.
title: Hassett Says Lost October Data Means ‘Cloudy’ Economic Outlook

author: Dylan Griffiths, Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: As Switzerland closes in on a deal with the US to lower tariffs on the country, it will owe thanks to some of its richest executives who played a key role in wooing President Donald Trump.
title: Swiss Billionaires Pivotal in Wooing Trump Ahead of Tariff Deal

author: Swati Gupta
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s alliance is leading in exit polls from elections in one of India’s poorest yet politically-pivotal states, suggesting a possible boost for the Indian leader after a year marked by economic headwinds and foreign policy challenges.
title: Exit Polls Show Modi Poised for Bihar Win After Tough Year

author: Julian Lee
description: Shipments slip to the lowest in two months after a third straight drop
title: Russia's Sliding Oil Flows and Prices Strain Putin’s War Chest

author: Ugur Yilmaz
description: A Turkish prosecutor has requested a prison sentence of more than 2,000 years for Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu in a corruption case, raising the prospect that President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s strongest challenger will be barred from the next presidential election.
title: Turkey Seeks More Than 2,000 Years Jail for Istanbul Mayor

author: Henrique Almeida
description: Portugal’s government has given Gonçalo Saraiva Matias a formidable mission: dismantle bureaucracy, raise salaries and cut housing costs to stem the exodus of skilled youth abroad.
title: Portugal’s New Anti-Bureaucracy Chief Vows to Stop Brain Drain

author: Sotiris Nikas
description: Greece plans to raise as much as €8 billion ($9.3 billion) from bond markets in 2026, keeping issuance limited to prioritize paying down debt, a person familiar with the matter said.
title: Greece Plans to Raise as Much as €8 Billion From Markets in 2026

author: Jasmina Kuzmanovic, Jan Bratanic
description: Students in the Serbian capital Belgrade demonstrated over plans to build a Trump Tower hotel complex on the site of the former Yugoslavia army headquarters, which has stood in ruins since 1999.
title: Trump Tower Plans in Belgrade Draw Thousands in Serbian Protest

author: Upmanyu Trivedi
description: The UK government won a key challenge against its use of hotels to house asylum seekers in a ruling that’s an effective backing of the Labour Party’s immigration policy.
title: UK Wins Crucial Lawsuit Over Housing Asylum Seekers in Hotel

author: Chunzi Xu, Mathieu Dion
description: Quebec’s main separatist political party is on the rise, and it’s turning some investors away from the province’s bonds.
title: Quebec’s Independence Talk Is Making Bond Investors Nervous

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: Gladys Harrison, owner of Big Mama’s Kitchen and Catering, was already struggling to cover rising food prices for ingredients at the Omaha restaurant that’s been in her family for two generations. Then, she got notice last month that her health-care premiums will nearly quadruple next year.
title: US Health Care Premium Spikes to Squeeze Main Street Businesses

author: Daniel Hornak, Stephen Carroll (Radio), Michal Kubala
description: The European Union reinforced a warning to Slovakia over constitutional changes that prioritize national law over EU legislation, with a senior official saying the bloc’s executive arm will decide soon whether to take legal action.
title: EU to Decide on Action Against Slovakia Over Primacy of Law

author: Dan Strumpf, Tooba Khan, Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: Deadly explosions in the capitals of India and Pakistan within 24 hours of each other killed at least 20 people and left several injured, heightening concern of renewed tensions between the nuclear-armed neighbors.
title: Explosions in India, Pakistan 24 Hours Apart Raise Tensions

author: Michael Nienaber
description: Germany’s federal police arrested a suspected right-wing extremist for allegedly plotting to assassinate more than a dozen politicians and public figures.
title: German Police Make Arrest Over Alleged Plot to Kill Politicians

author: Gian Volpicelli
description: Meta Platforms Inc.’s messaging service WhatsApp will face stricter rules under the European Union’s content moderation rulebook, as the bloc increases scrutiny of social media.
title: WhatsApp Set to Face Stricter Content Moderation Rules in the EU

author: Alex Wickham, Alberto Nardelli
description: The UK government rejected a request by the European Commission for as much €6.75 billion ($7.8 billion) to join its flagship defense fund, a blow to post-Brexit relations under Prime Minister Keir Starmer that also risks damaging Europe’s efforts to deter Russia.
title: UK Rejects EU Demand for €6.75 Billion to Join Key Defense Fund

author: Yian Lee
description: As anxiety over Donald Trump’s commitment to protecting Taiwan from Chinese military aggression lingers in Taipei, the island’s officials are fanning out across Europe to shore up friendships.
title: Taiwan Appeals to Europe in Bid to Secure Friends Beyond Trump

author: Abeer Abu Omar
description: The president must still overcome many challenges in charting a future for the war-ravaged nation.
title: Syria’s Hard Road Ahead After Trump Embrace of Al-Sharaa

author: Alaric Nightingale
description: Ukraine claimed a second attack this month on a key Rosneft PJSC refinery in Russia’s Volga region as military authorities in Kyiv continue to implement their strategy of striking Moscow’s oil-processing industry to curtail its energy revenues.
title: Ukraine Claims New Strike on Russia’s Saratov Refinery

author: Matthew Malinowski, Andrew Rosati
description: Los candidatos de derecha prometen medidas severas para impedir que los migrantes crucen la frontera. Pero este país, que envejece rápidamente, corre el riesgo de ir demasiado lejos.
title: Crece debate sobre migración ante proximidad de elecciones en Chile

author: Matthew Malinowski, Andrew Rosati
description: Right-wing candidates are vowing harsh measures to stop migrants from crossing the porous border. But the fast-aging country risks going too far.
title: Migrants Are Bracing for a Crackdown in Chile as Election Nears

author: Kamil Kowalcze, Samy Adghirni
description: Europe needs to protect key industries from China and avoid becoming dependent on the Asian nation for rare earths and other critical raw materials, according to a French minister.
title: French Minister Urges Caution on Europe’s Relations With China

author: Ott Ummelas, Heidi Taksdal Skjeseth
description: Norwegian Finance Minister Jens Stoltenberg said politicians suspended ethics rules governing the world’s biggest sovereign wealth fund after the divestment of Caterpillar Inc. stock stoked fears of a firesale of tech holdings, worth as much as $230 billion.
title: Norway Averted $230 Billion Tech Sale With Oil Fund Ethics Pause

author: Shoko Oda, Stephen Stapczynski
description: The governor of Japan’s Niigata Prefecture will make a rare visit to one of the country’s most-troubled nuclear power plants this week, an event that will be watched closely by gas traders for any hint that the facility might be restarted.
title: Japan Governor’s Visit to Nuclear Reactor Raises Restart Hopes

author: John Ainger, Daniel Carvalho, Alfred Cang, Akshat Rathi
description: Delegates from nearly 200 countries have gathered in Belém in the Brazilian Amazon for the United Nations’ COP30 climate conference, running through Nov. 21.
title: Who’s Who Inside Negotiating Rooms at the COP30 Climate Summit

author: Andras Gergely
description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s pre-election spending is forcing the government to raise its budget deficit targets, with extra funding to be sourced from banking taxes and foreign-currency bonds.
title: Hungary to Loosen Budget, Hit Banks for Orban Election Spending

author: Rakesh Sharma
description: India has scaled back purchases of Russian crude for arrival in December, showing that Western sanctions and trade talks with the US are having a major impact on buying patterns.
title: Most Indian Oil Refiners Skip Buying Russian Crude for December

author: Preeti Soni, Swati Gupta
description: India imposed stricter pollution control measures for New Delhi and its neighboring regions on Tuesday following rare public protests demanding stronger action.
title: India’s Capital Tightens Anti-Pollution Measures After Protests

author: Helen Nyambura
description: Tanzanian police freed four opposition leaders on bail, as a crackdown on dissent continues after a disputed election in which President Samia Suluhu Hassan was declared the winner with almost 98% of the vote.
title: Tanzania Releases Four Opposition Leaders on Bail Amid Crackdown

author: Selcan Hacaoglu
description: The US urged NATO allies to stop buying Russian energy in order to help end the war in Ukraine, adding pressure on member countries such as Turkey even as they cut back their purchases.
title: US Urges NATO Allies Like Turkey to Stop Buying Russian Energy

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand suspended a peace process with Cambodia agreed last month alongside US President Donald Trump after Thai soldiers were injured by land mines along their border.
title: Thailand Suspends US-Backed Cambodia Peace Deal Amid Trade Talks

author: Erik Wasson, Steven T. Dennis, Jamie Tarabay
description: A record-setting 41-day US government shutdown is on a path to end as soon as Wednesday after the Senate passed a temporary funding measure backed by a group of eight centrist Democrats.
title: US Shutdown Nears End as Senate Passes Deal, House Still to Act

author: Paul Allen, Michael Heath
description: China has intensified its competition with the US for influence in the Indo-Pacific, and Beijing’s recent gains in the regional contest are “undeniable,” former Deputy Secretary of State Kurt Campbell said.
title: China Gains in Asia Great Game Are ‘Undeniable,’ Biden Official Says

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Erik Larson
description: President Donald Trump asked the US Supreme Court to reverse a $5 million sexual abuse and defamation judgment against him in a civil lawsuit by former Elle magazine advice columnist E. Jean Carroll.
title: Trump Asks Supreme Court to Toss E. Jean Carroll Judgment

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump downplayed criticism of the potential creation of a 50-year mortgage product, saying it would help more Americans afford monthly payments on homes.
title: Trump Defends 50-Year Mortgage Plan, Calling It ‘Not a Big Deal’

author: Stephen Stapczynski
description: A tanker carrying US-sanctioned Russian liquefied natural gas and masking its location was spotted near China, according to SynMax, suggesting Beijing is stepping up its efforts to buy the fuel.
title: Tanker Spoofing Its Location Seen Taking Sanctioned LNG to China

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump defended allowing foreign students to study in the US as a “good” practice and pushed back on a call to reduce their numbers, saying it would be financially destructive to the nation’s higher education system.
title: Trump Defends Foreign Students as ‘Good’ for US Universities

author: Kelcee Griffis, Hannah Miller
description: Donald Trump notched another victory in his war on the media when the UK’s national broadcaster apologized over a misleading edit of the US president’s remarks and two executives resigned.
title: Trump’s War on the Media Goes International With BBC Apology

author: Greg Stohr
description: President Donald Trump’s administration told the US Supreme Court that he could have sent active-duty military troops to Chicago to help enforce federal immigration laws, as he urged the court to instead let him deploy the National Guard.
title: Trump Could Have Sent Military to Chicago, Official Tells Court
